Description: Textile fragment of undyed linen cloth; blue mark between self-bands and fringe. Same as BM 6566, but with the following differences: 6569 has a fringe but no selvedge; 6569 has a blue mark in the form of an inlaid flat S of paired blue threads in consecutive sheds - this is 6cm long and is between self-bands and fringe (2cm below the self band) 6569 shows wear much more clearly than 6566. The weave is a compact basket weave [warp-faced extended tabby] and the threads are S-spun; the stitch gauge is warp c.12.5 pairs of threads per 10mm and weft c.6.5-7 threads per 10mm.
Curator's comments: Part of BM6566 Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1993]
